name: Extract site/ into standalone repo
description: git subtree split --prefix=site into a new 'cs2-demo-viewer' repo. Preserve commit history. Push to new GitHub remote.
steps: Run git subtree split --prefix=site -b demo-viewer
Create new GitHub repo (cs2-demo-viewer)
Push demo-viewer branch to new repo as main
Verify commit history is preserved

name: Rename and rebrand
description: Update package.json name from 'site' to 'cs2-demo-viewer'. Update layout.tsx metadata. Remove any chimera-specific branding from the landing page.
steps: Update package.json name field
Update page title and metadata in layout.tsx
Clean up page.tsx if it references chimera project content
Verify npm run build still works

name: Add sample data and data format docs
description: Document the expected JSON format for viewer-data/ and maps/ so users can bring their own data. Add a small sample dataset (one round) for testing. Add a .gitkeep or example to public/viewer-data/ and public/maps/.
steps: Create docs/data-format.md describing index.json, meta.json, round_XX.json schemas
Create docs/data-format.md section for maps/ (radar PNGs + map-data.json)
Add a minimal sample round JSON for testing
Verify viewer loads sample data correctly

name: Write README for standalone repo
description: Clear README with: what it is, screenshot/gif, quickstart (npm install, add data, npm run dev), data format reference, tech stack, license.
steps: Write README.md with project description
Add quickstart instructions
Reference data format docs
Add tech stack section (Next.js 16, React 19, Tailwind v4)
Add MIT license

name: Clean up chimera repo reference
description: After extraction, ensure chimera repo still works. site/ stays as-is in chimera (subtree split doesn't remove it). Optionally add a note in chimera README pointing to the standalone viewer repo.
steps: Verify chimera site/ still builds and works
Add note in chimera README linking to cs2-demo-viewer repo
Verify chimera init.sh still works
